abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Yemen Southern Regional Agricultural
            Development Project. The main objectives of the project
            were: (a) to increase agricultural productivity and incomes
            of farmers on 120,000 hectares, including those of the low
            rainfall areas of the region by means of improved
            agricultural services; improved utilization of land and
            water resources; and special assistance to women farmers;
            and (b) to improve the health and nutrition standards of the
            rural families through improved extension services to rural
            women. Bank's performance was satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory. The key
            lessons learned from the project were as follows: (a) the
            timely availability of adequate recurrent local operational
            budget is vital for the long-term sustainability of the
            project; (b) effective management of complex projects
            requires an efficient regional coordination mechanism; (c)
            there is a need to set up and implement a pragmatic
            mechanism to forge effective and close links between
            extension and research activities under the concerned
            projects; (d) the development and adoption of M and E
            systems should build on existing practices and take into
            account the national capacity and training needs to enable
            local operation and management of the systems; and (e) the
            benefits of close and coordinated working relationship with
            other cofinanciers of the project.
